Parts.A: This quest can only be done once per day, so you'll have to come back later.

Well, hello there. Are you new around here?

Ah, nevermind. It doesn't matter much to me anyway. Just a weak attempt at socializing, ya know?
Any way, I have a job for you, if you'd be interested? It could be slightly dangerous.
Parts.B: Sure, let me hear about it
Parts.C: Nah, I'm good. Hope you find another fool.

Parts.A:
Oh, you're a dum... brave one, aren't you?

So, this is the deal. I own an old mansion up near Eyelet Lake, I left something there a while back, and I need someone to go an' fetch it for me. 
I'd go myself, but these old knees can't handle the cold up there anymore. 

If you're game for it, there'd of course be a small reward in it for you.
Parts.C: I'd rather have a drink. See you around.

Parts.A:
Good, good.

Now, to get to the mansion, you'd go up to Eyelet Lake, and then turn left up between the hills. When you get up the hill, then you should see a gravel road to the right. That will lead you right to the mansion. 

What you're looking for is in a large black chest in the study, so grab that and return it to me. Then I'll pay you ***10 gold crowns*** when you return it to me here. 

Here's the key to the place. Can't have you go an' knock down the door because you can't get in.
Parts.C: I changed my mind, I'm not going.

Parts.A: Find the haunted mansion near Eyelet Lake.

Ah, you're aliv... back. 
Good to see you, friend. Did you bring back what I asked you?
Parts.C: Uhm, not yet. Just needed a drink...

Parts.A:
Ah, you're aliv... back. 
Good to see you, friend. Did you bring back what I asked you? Oh, and my key of course.
Parts.B: Yes, I have it right here!
Parts.C: Uhm, not yet. Just needed a drink...

Parts.A: But this isn't what I sent you to fetch. You got to go back and get the right one!
Well, good to see that there still is honesty in the world. Here is your gold, and thank you for helping an old man.
